bibl.title: Addition to the Demotic Papyri from Gamhud.
bibl.note: First Hungarian excavation in Egypt (started in 1907), near Gamhud (i.e. Tholthis, in the Oxyrhynchite nome). Examines the Demotic papyri preserved in the Museum of Fine Arts, Budapest, and hitherto published (by Ulrich Luft), and presents a new fragment from the 2nd century BC, P. Bud. Inv. 56.95.A (from a cartonnage). The fragment mentions a chief lesonis, an official elected to manage and control the economic and financial affairs of a temple. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Zsuzsanna Szántó, Addition to the Demotic Papyri from Gamhud.

First Hungarian excavation in Egypt (started in 1907), near Gamhud (i.e. Tholthis, in the Oxyrhynchite nome). Examines the Demotic papyri preserved in the Museum of Fine Arts, Budapest, and hitherto published (by Ulrich Luft), and presents a new fragment from the 2nd century BC, P. Bud. Inv. 56.95.A (from a cartonnage). The fragment mentions a chief lesonis, an official elected to manage and control the economic and financial affairs of a temple. - Avec résumé en anglais.
